title: Letters: Too many in Westminster still misinterpret the Brexiteers' ethos
text:
SIR – Lord Hague seems to misconceive the motivations and aspirations of the Leave-voting majority.

We were not voting to “defend the formidable power of our sovereign Parliament”, especially when that Parliament is already so obviously unrepresentative of our views. We voted to restore the sovereign power of the British people over its lawmakers, so that they were fully accountable to us.

Now we see that power being snatched away from us again by MPs so they can hand it back to Brussels. We did not vote for a Brexit in name only; nor, despite the claims of many Remainers, did we vote for Brexit only so long as it was contingent on a “deal”. Above all, we did not vote to see our Parliament arrogate...
description: SIR – Lord Hague seems to misconceive the motivations and aspirations of the Leave-voting majority.
